title: Mobile-Based Environmental Mathematics Microlearning Program: Interest-Evoking Design Using ADDIE and Isman Models

context.prior_knowledge: Advanced-level specialized knowledge in the field and extensive practical experience
context.additional_context: Environmental mathematics content focusing on data visualization and problem-solving activities in smartphone-based learning, with project-based assessments to evaluate real-life application skills.

learning_goals: Learners can write regional environmental problem analysis reports utilizing mathematical modeling

Learners can visualize a 2020–2023 country-specific carbon emissions dataset using Python’s Matplotlib/Seaborn or R’s ggplot2, apply ≥3 statistical interpretation strategies (mean comparison, trend analysis, correlation), and write an analysis report.

Learners can apply the 5 stages of the ADDIE model (Analysis-Design-Development-Implementation-Evaluation) to complete a math-based design project (e.g., energy efficiency optimization model) reflecting ≥3 sustainability principles (environmental, social, economic) within 6 months and receive ≥4 points (5-point scale) from an expert evaluation panel.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
